Steeeeve

The one article Simone would like posted on Drudge Report:
 
 U.S. healthcare reform bill: 14 rebel states sue | Mail Online
 
 I figured the republicans were probably not true to their concerns about the deficit and fiscal responsibility and the stupidity showed in this study basically confirms my fears in a way.
 
 57% believe he is a Muslim? 
 almost 25% think he is the anti-christ? 
 
 Obama is basically following the same policies as Bush only doing it faster and bolder. I guess democrats think Bush is the anti-christ too so maybe its even...either way....WOW, speaks a lot about our population.
 
 For the record, Obama is not the anti-christ, not a muslim, and not a socialist by conventional terms. He certainly isn't a centrist either. He is, however, incompetent.
 
 Looks like I'm once again without a party. Thanks for tainting real issues teabaggers!

Steeeeve

Al Sharpton would disagree.
 YouTube - Al Sharpton admits Obama = Socialism

 
 Then you know it is a dumb statement! I've heard Sharpton speak and he is a hypocrite and doesn't appear to be a good person from my personal experience. 
 
 Really we should be so lucky to get socialism at this point. Here is an email I got which describes this so well: 
 SOCIALISM
 You have 2 cows.
 You give one to your neighbour.
 
 COMMUNISM
 You have 2 cows.
 The State takes both and gives you some milk.
 
 FASCISM
 You have 2 cows.
 The State takes both and sells you some milk.
 In the case of health care, Obama is going to take our money and force us to buy insurance. Thanks! Insurance companies and drug companies bought it because it benefits them in the near term but like most corporations they look about one quarter ahead and thats it. I think long term they will be screwed over. 
 
 Anyway, Socialism is just inefficient no growth or innovation and we all kind of live simply. This is not Obama's America. I think Facism is much much closer.
 
 Let's get the vocabulary right :)
 
 EDIT: After watching that video, I'm not sure that is what Sharpton was saying...seems out of context.

 Socialism, you have two cows, the government makes you give it to your neighbor, who has no idea how to milk or take care of a cow.
 
 Communism, you have two cows and the government/state takes them both and rations the milk so much that everyone has osteoperosis.emoticon_frazzled
 
 Fascism, you have two cows and the government/state takes them both and sells milk to you for twice the price you would pay for the cows.
 
 Sure the way you describe it sounds great, if the world were that simple and perfect.

Capitalism: you don't own any cows, you can feed and take care of someone else's cows in return for a small amount of milk. Meanwhile they sell the rest of the milk and buy more cows.

 
 At least with capitalism you have the option of working hard, saving your money, and buying your own cow. That's the difference with capitalism, your success is based on your initiative and hard work. So many people who are opposed to capitalism simply are opposed to taking personal responsibility for their lives.
